abstract: The Italian bank UniCredit agreed to buy Capitalia for $29.5 billion as consolidation in Europe’s banking industry gathers pace.
snippet: The Italian bank UniCredit agreed to buy Capitalia for $29.5 billion as consolidation in Europe’s banking industry gathers pace.
lead_paragraph: LONDON, May 20 — The Italian bank UniCredit agreed today to buy a rival, Capitalia, in an all-stock deal valued at 21.8 billion euros, or about $29.5 billion, that would create Europe’s second-biggest bank behind HSBC Holdings.

headline.print_headline: $29.5 Billion Deal to Create Europe’s 2nd-Biggest Bank
